rationale: No intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifies a risk-adjective.
The segment reports confirmation factually ('positive cases were confirmed') without high-potency framing.
Neutral language used; no moderate verb paired with scale/impact.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
This segment reports a fact (confirmation) and lacks explicit calming language.
Segment does not contain a minimiser used with scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
States a fact about cases being confirmed.
